background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.

We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.

research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化地表温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季地表温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区地表冷却的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中起着关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列如何影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。
我们的目标是将热带低频（TP LST/SUBT）对全球大气环流的影响与热带环流波列（TRC wave train）的动态特征相结合，重点关注其在改善季节到季节（S2S）预测中的重要性。

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验是由ESMs进行的，旨在测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。
datasetCn: 模拟的200 hPa位势高度差的集合均值在图5a中展示，同时与2003年5月的观测数据（图5b）一起，进一步探讨了大气环流对青藏 Plateau（TP）地表温度/土壤湿度效应的响应。

在图1a中显示了青藏高原(TP)的观测气温(T2m)异常，我们使用来自美国国家海洋和大气管理局(NOAA)气候异常监测系统(CAMS, Fan和van den Dool 2008)的数据。我们使用第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心(ECMWF)大气重分析(ERA5, Hersbach等，2020)，该数据被称为观测数据，具有1.0° × 1.0°的常规水平分辨率，以研究2003年的大气环流以及气候学，后者定义为1981年至2015年的平均值。所有数据均以0.5° × 0.5°的空间分辨率提供。全球降水数据来自气候研究单位(CRU)，在实施分析时使用版本4.02(Harris等，2014; 2020)。
findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的表面温度异常可以通过青藏 Plateau（TP）调制一个持久的准纬向青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球（TRC）波列，从TP经东北亚和白令海峡传播到北美西部，以及春季从TP横跨整个北太平洋盆地的西风急流。由TP热异常调制的TRC波列在早夏的表面气温和降水异常中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美西北部和南部大平原地区。这些结果表明，TP的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过TRC波列是上述地区季节到季节（S2S）变率的主要来源。

这些结果综合表明，青藏 Plateau（TP）的波列在影响TP表面和地下温度对热点区域的作用中起着关键作用，特别是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的详细机制仍需进一步研究。集合模型模拟显示，在强西风急流穿越亚太地区的情况下，TP表面降温会产生一个从TP通过东北亚和白令海峡延伸到北美西部的条带性、持久性（演变时间尺度超过一个月）的TRC波列，其特征与2003年5月至6月观察到的地势高度异常非常相似。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括了大量高影响事件，如干旱和洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏高原（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水之间存在滞后相关性，但当前的全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在不同尺度气候系统中的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探索它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候方面发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常之间的联系，如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜，已被用于预测气候事件，并在几个月到几年范围内具有有用的技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原的春季地面温度可能会影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种地表变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但在陆气相互作用研究中，特别是在S2S预测中的应用仍然被忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度一样大。LS4P的目标是检验2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，往往集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法充分保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在西澳大利亚和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，和/或涉及其他过程吗？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录被用来检查TP T2m与全球降水之间可能的关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用了16个最先进的LS4P ESM（表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP上的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP上的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点和中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。观察结果和多个地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，可以改善5月TP地区的地面温度模拟，从而使ESM更好地预测6月在热点地区的降水，并且高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热带来的新的S2S可预测性来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a challenge faced when collecting data for modeling land-atmosphere interactions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集用于建模陆地-大气相互作用的数据时面临的一个挑战的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in modeling land-atmosphere interactions is the inability of state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Example.AnswerCn: 建模陆气相互作用的一个挑战是，最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度异常的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据的不足。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'ensemble mean' refer to in the context of climatological data analysis?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在气候数据分析的背景下，“集合平均”指的是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of climatological data analysis, 'ensemble mean' refers to the average result obtained from multiple simulations or models. This technique is used to predict or simulate weather and climate conditions by considering the outputs from various Earth System Models (ESMs), providing a more robust and reliable prediction through the averaging of different model outputs.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在气候数据分析的背景下，“集合均值”指的是从多个模拟或模型中获得的平均结果。这种技术用于通过考虑来自不同地球系统模型（ESMs）的输出，预测或模拟天气和气候条件，通过对不同模型输出的平均，提供更稳健和可靠的预测。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack' defined in the context of improving subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在改善次季节到季节（S2S）预测的背景下，如何定义“地表温度和积雪初始化”？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of improving S2S predictions, 'initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack' involves setting initial conditions of land temperature and snowpack in climate models to reflect observed anomalies. This process aims to enhance the predictive skill of climate models by ensuring that the initial states of these variables are accurately represented, which is crucial for capturing the influence of land surface conditions on atmospheric circulations and precipitation patterns.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在改善S2S预测的背景下，“地表温度和雪盖的初始化”涉及在气候模型中设置地表温度和雪盖的初始条件，以反映观测到的异常。这一过程旨在提高气候模型的预测能力，确保这些变量的初始状态被准确表示，这对于捕捉地表条件对大气环流和降水模式的影响至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods for initializing land surface/subsurface temperature in high mountain areas compare with those used for sea surface temperature anomalies in terms of their impact on subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 高山地区地表/地下温度初始化的数据收集方法与海表温度异常的数据收集方法在对亚季节到季节预测准确性的影响方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Data collection for land surface/subsurface temperature in high mountain areas, like the Tibetan Plateau, involves using observed T2m records and innovative initialization techniques to address model biases, which can significantly enhance prediction skill by accounting for land-atmosphere interactions. In contrast, sea surface temperature anomalies are traditionally linked to climate events like El Niño and La Niña and are more consistently integrated into models. However, both methods highlight different sources of predictability, with land temperatures providing a new predictability source comparable to ocean temperatures over identified hotspot regions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 在高山地区，如青藏高原，土地表面/地下温度的数据收集涉及使用观测的2米温度记录和创新的初始化技术，以解决模型偏差，这可以显著增强预测技能，因为它考虑了陆地与大气之间的相互作用。相比之下，海表温度异常通常与气候事件如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜相关，并且更一致地融入模型中。然而，这两种方法突出了不同的可预测性来源，陆地温度提供了一种新的可预测性来源，与识别的热点区域的海洋温度相当。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using observational data from land surface temperature (LST) compared to sea surface temperature (SST) in enhancing subseasonal-to-seasonal climate models?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用陆地表面温度（LST）与海洋表面温度（SST）观察数据在增强亚季节到季节气候模型时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Challenges with observational data for land surface temperature include the need for robust land initialization and model configuration, as well as preserving memory from initialized LST anomalies. These processes are critical yet scientifically challenging due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial conditions. In contrast, while sea surface temperature has been a well-established source of predictability, it only partially explains climate variability, indicating its limitations. Both sources face challenges in accurately representing their respective influences on atmospheric circulations in climate models.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 观测数据在陆地表面温度方面的挑战包括对稳健的陆地初始化和模型配置的需求，以及保持初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆。这些过程至关重要，但由于模型参数化的不足和初始条件的不平衡，科学上具有挑战性。相比之下，虽然海表温度已被确立为一个良好的可预测性来源，但它仅部分解释气候变异，表明其局限性。这两种来源在气候模型中准确表示其对大气环流的影响方面都面临挑战。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What techniques can be used to interpret the relationship between land surface temperature anomalies and global precipitation patterns in climatological datasets?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以使用哪些技术来解释地表温度异常与全球降水模式在气候数据集中的关系？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Techniques such as simulating atmospheric circulation responses using Earth System Models (ESMs) and analyzing temperature and precipitation anomalies through observational datasets like NOAA Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) and ERA5 reanalysis data can be used to interpret the relationship between land surface temperature anomalies and global precipitation patterns.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用地球系统模型（ESMs）模拟大气环流响应，以及通过像NOAA气候异常监测系统（CAMS）和ERA5再分析数据这样的观测数据集分析温度和降水异常，可以用来解释地表温度异常与全球降水模式之间的关系。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in interpreting the inter-model differences when simulating the propagation pathways of wave trains from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在模拟波列从青藏高原传播到南半球的路径时，解释模型间差异可能会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in interpreting these differences include understanding the large variability due to model parameterization and reanalysis data deficiencies, which may lead to inconsistencies between simulated and observed wave train propagation pathways, affecting the accuracy of climate anomaly predictions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 解释这些差异的挑战包括理解由于模型参数化和再分析数据缺陷导致的大量变异，这可能导致模拟和观测的波列传播路径之间的不一致，从而影响气候异常预测的准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the biases in model simulations of Tibetan Plateau temperature anomalies, and how do these biases affect data collection methods?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响青藏高原温度异常模型模拟偏差的因素有哪些，这些偏差又如何影响数据收集方法？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The biases in model simulations of Tibetan Plateau temperature anomalies are influenced by deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions from reanalysis data. These biases can affect data collection methods by necessitating adjustments in initial conditions, such as initializing land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over the Tibetan Plateau to better simulate observed anomalies.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 模型模拟的青藏高原温度异常偏差受到模型参数化缺陷和再分析数据中不平衡的初始大气/陆地条件的影响。这些偏差可能会影响数据收集方法， necessitating 在初始条件中进行调整，例如初始化青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度，以更好地模拟观察到的异常。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a significant challenge in using current Earth System Models to fully preserve the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么使用当前的地球系统模型来完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆存在重大挑战？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenge in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in Earth System Models arises from deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions provided by reanalysis data. This affects the models' ability to retain the influence of these anomalies over time, which is critical for accurate subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在地球系统模型中，保存初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆面临挑战，这源于模型参数化的缺陷以及再分析数据提供的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件。这影响了模型在时间上保持这些异常影响的能力，而这对于准确的亚季节到季节预测至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the discrepancies between observed and simulated precipitation anomalies in Earth System Models, particularly in regions like western Australia and western Europe?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致地球系统模型中观察到的降水异常与模拟降水异常之间存在差异的原因是什么，特别是在西澳大利亚和西欧等地区？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Discrepancies between observed and simulated precipitation anomalies can be caused by model deficiencies in capturing the full effect of Tibetan Plateau temperature anomalies, as well as potential inaccuracies in model configuration and land initialization processes. These factors can lead to significant differences in predicted precipitation patterns compared to observations.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 观测到的降水异常与模拟降水异常之间的差异可能是由于模型在捕捉青藏高原温度异常的全面影响方面存在缺陷，以及模型配置和土地初始化过程中的潜在不准确性。这些因素可能导致预测的降水模式与观测结果之间存在显著差异。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to explore the global atmospheric response to Tibetan Plateau land surface cooling using Earth System Models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么使用地球系统模型探索青藏高原地表冷却对全球大气的响应很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Exploring the global atmospheric response to Tibetan Plateau land surface cooling using Earth System Models is important to understand the mechanisms behind climate variability and identify new predictability sources at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales, which can enhance the accuracy of climate predictions across various regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 探索青藏 Plateau 地表降温对全球大气的响应，使用地球系统模型对于理解气候变异背后的机制以及识别亚季节到季节时间尺度的新可预测性来源是重要的，这可以提高各个地区气候预测的准确性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What data collection techniques are used to obtain high-resolution atmospheric circulation data for model evaluation in climatological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在气候研究中，用于获取高分辨率大气环流数据以进行模型评估的数据收集技术有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: High-resolution atmospheric circulation data are obtained using the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5) with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0°, supplemented with Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) data for temperature anomalies, and Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 高分辨率的大气环流数据是通过第五代欧洲中期天气预报中心大气重分析（ERA5）获得的，水平分辨率为1.0° × 1.0°，并辅以气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的温度异常数据和气候研究单位（CRU）的全球降水数据。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature conditions approached to improve subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions in Earth System Models?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何通过改进地球系统模型中的陆地表面和地下温度条件的初始化来提高亚季节到季节气候预测？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To improve subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions, the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature conditions is approached by reducing model bias through adjusting initial conditions based on observed temperature anomalies, allowing better simulation of temperature effects on precipitation prediction.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了改善季节内到季节的气候预测，通过基于观测到的温度异常调整初始条件来减少模型偏差，从而初始化陆地表面和地下温度条件，这样可以更好地模拟温度对降水预测的影响。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in simulating atmospheric responses to temperature anomalies, and how are these addressed through experimental design?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在模拟大气对温度异常的响应时面临哪些挑战，以及通过实验设计如何解决这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Challenges in simulating atmospheric responses to temperature anomalies include inter-model differences and biases in temperature representation. These are addressed by conducting control and sensitivity experiments with multiple Earth System Models, adjusting initial conditions, and comparing ensemble means to observations for validation.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 模拟大气对温度异常反应的挑战包括模型间差异和温度表示的偏差。这些问题通过进行控制实验和敏感性实验，使用多个地球系统模型，调整初始条件，并将集合均值与观测数据进行比较以进行验证来解决。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the accurate initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得能够准确初始化地表温度和雪盖条件，从而改善亚季节到季节的预测模型？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack conditions is critical and remains scientifically challenging. It involves using advanced Earth System Models (ESMs) that incorporate bias-adjusted initial conditions based on observed anomalies, particularly for high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau. These advancements allow for better simulation of atmospheric circulation responses and the prediction of precipitation anomalies.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 土地表面温度和雪盖条件的初始化至关重要，但仍然具有科学挑战性。这涉及使用先进的地球系统模型（ESMs），这些模型基于观测到的异常情况，结合偏差调整的初始条件，特别是在像青藏高原这样的高山地区。这些进展使得更好地模拟大气环流响应和预测降水异常成为可能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: In what ways can improving the initialization of land surface temperature over high-mountain areas lead to advancements in subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 改善高山地区地表温度的初始化可以通过哪些方式促进次季节到季节气候预测的进步？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Improving the initialization of land surface temperature over high-mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, can lead to significant advancements in subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions. By better capturing the thermal anomalies and their influence on atmospheric circulation, models can more accurately predict precipitation anomalies and enhance predictability in regions identified as global 'hotspots,' potentially matching the predictability influence of sea surface temperatures.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 改善高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度初始化，可以显著提升季节内到季节气候预测的准确性。通过更好地捕捉热异常及其对大气环流的影响，模型能够更准确地预测降水异常，并增强在被识别为全球“热点”地区的可预测性，潜在地与海表温度的可预测性影响相匹配。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么模拟从青藏高原到南半球的传播路径会存在较大的模型间差异？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The large inter-model differences could be due to the models' inability to fully preserve memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies, deficiencies in model parameterizations, and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions in reanalysis data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 大型模型间的差异可能是由于模型无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆、模型参数化的缺陷，以及再分析数据中大气/陆地初始条件的不平衡所致。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might enhanced initialization of land surface and subsurface temperatures over high mountain regions lead to improved precipitation prediction skill?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 增强高山地区地表和地下温度的初始化可能会提高降水预测技能的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Enhanced initialization could lead to improved prediction skill as it allows models to better simulate observed temperature anomalies, enabling the models to more accurately predict downstream effects on precipitation, particularly in identified hotspot regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 增强初始化可以提高预测技能，因为它使模型更好地模拟观察到的温度异常，从而使模型能够更准确地预测对降水的下游影响，特别是在已识别的热点区域。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack impact the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal climate predictions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 土地表面温度和雪盖的初始化如何影响亚季节到季节气候预测的准确性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and snowpack can enhance the accuracy of climate predictions by reducing biases in model simulations, particularly in high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau. This approach helps in better capturing the land-atmosphere interactions and improves the prediction of precipitation anomalies over global hotspot regions.

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced by Earth System Models in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies?
